NORTON--Lew. The New York Philharmonic mourns the passing, on November 2, of Lew Norton, a bassist in the Orchestra, 1967-2006. We extend our deepest condolences to his wife, Val; daughters, Sydney and Kathryn; son-in-laws, Robert and Gabriel; grandson, Arthur; and the rest of his family. 1/3
SANOFF--Danny A. Always in my heart. Miss you. Love, Mom
ROTHSCHILD--Dr. John . November 5, 2010 . Always in our hearts. The Marchia Family
MOSCOT--Kenny Charles. 1/9/70 - 11/5/2010. Time will never diminish the pain of the loss of our beloved Kenny. Your heartbroken Family
KLEIN--Phyllis. Phyl, a dozen years have passed in an instant and you remain deeply within our hearts and souls. Henry, Emily & Peter

UPSON--Stuart B. The Fresh Air Fund, its Board of Directors and staff mourn the passing of Stuart B. Upson. Stu was a member of The Fund's Board of Directors for 35 years, including his service as Board President. As an advertising legend at Saatchi & Saatchi, originally Dancer Fitzgerald Sample, he spearheaded several brilliant pro bono public service advertising campaigns to support The Fresh Air Fund. His leadership, charm and talent will be greatly missed. We offer our deepest sympathy and heartfelt condolences to his family. We are deeply saddened by the loss of our distinguished colleague and dear friend. William P. Lauder Chairman of the Board John N. Irwin III President Jenny Morgenthau Executive Director The Fresh Air Fund

UPSON-Stuart B. Stuart B. Upson, age 89, of Darien, CT, a prominent advertising executive and industry leader whose career spanned six decades at one agency, died October 31. He was a graduate of Phillips Exeter Academy and Yale University and served in the U.S. Navy. He began his career with Dancer Fitzgerald Sample in 1948 and retired in 2011 as Chairman Emeritus of Saatchi & Saatchi. He leaves his wife of 68 years, Barbara Jussen Upson; three children, Meg Nichols (Ed), Anne Marcus (John), and Stuart Upson Jr. (Kate), seven grandchildren and three great grandchildren. A memorial service will be held Saturday, November 8, 11:30am, St. Luke's Church, 1864 Post Road, Darien, CT. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to The Fresh Air Fund, 633 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10017 or Post 53, Zero Ledge Road, Darien, CT 06820.

SPITZER--Bernard. The Board of Trustees and staff of New York Public Radio mourn the loss of Bernard Spitzer. Bernard was a great New York philanthropist and the support of the Spitzer family helped to transform New York Public Radio. His wife Anne served with extraordinary passion on the New York Public Radio Board of Trustees for five years. We extend our deepest condolences to Anne, Eliot, Daniel, Emily and the entire Spitzer family. Cynthia King Vance, Chair; Laura Walker, President and CEO
SPITZER--Bernard. A friend of great intellect, humor, strength and philanthropy. Our condolences to Anne and the family. Elaine and Alan Weiler

SPITZER--Bernard E. AJC mourns the passing of our dear friend and generous supporter for decades. A legendary real estate developer, Bernard also sought tirelessly to develop and ensure a strong Jewish future and a future of human rights and democratic values for all. We are deeply grateful for his friendship, and send our heartfelt condolences to his wife, Anne, and his grieving family. Stanley Bergman, AJC President David Harris, AJC Executive Director

SPITZER--Bernard. The City College of New York mourns the passing of its distinguished alumni Bernard Spitzer, Class of 1943. Mr. Spitzer earned a degree in engineering and was a longtime supporter of his alma mater. The Bernard and Anne Spitzer Charitable Trust donated a gift to City College for the Bernard and Anne Spitzer School of Architecture, and the Spitzers endowed the Anne and Bernard Spitzer Chair in Political Science in the Colin Powell School for Civic and Global Leadership. Mr. Spitzer also supported travel grants for students to study abroad. While many will remember Mr. Spitzer for building some of New York's most iconic buildings, at City College we'll remember him as an ardent supporter of higher education who established structures and programs for faculty and student success. On behalf of City College, we extend our sincerest condolences to the Spitzer family. Lisa S. Coico, President

SOLOMON--Bertha, on November 2, 2014. Devoted wife of the late Herman. Loving mother of Sheila and Jay Cohen, Sharon and Louis Moskowitz. Adored grandmother of Lorin, Steven, Penny and Hillary. Cherished great-grandmother of Lily, Hannah, Max, Elizabeth, Jason, Madison, Sophia and Isabelle. Family graveside services were held Tuesday, November 4, 2014.

SHOWERS--Eric J.,85, a resident of Larchmont passed away on November 3, 2014. Beloved husband of Patricia, devoted father of Eric B. (Angela), James (Michele), Robert (Abigail) and Andrew (Annmarie). Loving Grandfather of ten. A graduate of Williams College, he served in the US Air Force from 1951-1953 and had a long career on Wall Street. Eric was a member of the Larchmont Yacht Club and of the Bald Peak Colony Club in Melvin Village, New Hampshire. Visiting Thursday 2-4pm and 7-9pm at John J. Fox Funeral Home, Inc. in Larchmont. Mass Friday, 10:00am at St. Augustine Church in Larchmont.

SATO--Marilyn Joan, beloved mother of Kanna and Miyazu, wife of the late Chikafusa Sato, Marilyn Sato passed away peacefully on November 2nd, 2014. Born on October 16th, 1939 in New York, she is the daughter of the late Joseph and Catherine Kirincich. Marilyn lived in Tokyo, Japan for 30 years where she raised her family, taught gourmet cooking and conversational English and in addition was an accomplished ceramicist. Marilyn is survived by her children, Kanna (Mario), Miyazu (Ron), grandchildren Renzo, Mina and Kaya, brother Robert (Tabitha), as well as cousins, nieces, nephews and friends. She will be missed deeply. A memorial gathering will be held on Thursday, November 6th from 3:30-5:30pm at Frank E. Campbell The Funeral Chapel, 1076 Madison Avenue at 81st Street, New York, NY 10028. In lieu of flowers, contributions can be made to the Central Park Conservancy Adopt-a-Bench program in her name (website pending) or to a charity of one's choice.

PROVENZANO--Adele, on November 4, 2014 of Jericho, NY. Beloved aunt of Leslie Siegel and Steven and Hillary Siegel. Great-aunt of Alexa and Andrew Siegel. Loving sister of the late Burton Siegel. Devoted companion of Everett Fleisig. Services: Thursday, 12 noon at "Gutterman's" 8000 Jericho Tpke. Woodbury, NY. Interment Knollwood Park Cemetery.
PIMSLER--Alvin. The trustees and members of the Artists' Fellowship mourn the loss of our former President and supporter Alvin Pimsler. His presence will be greatly missed.
MILLER--Joan. A "Remembering Jo" event will be held at 281 Woodland Rd., Highland Park, IL on November 25, 5-7pm.

MERLINO--Frank M.,November 1, 1939 - November 1, 2014. Born in Stamford, CT. Long time resident of NYC, NY and New Paltz NY. Beloved spouse of Stephen M Feldman. Brother of Marie Pia. Uncle of Grace Pia, Michael Pia and Elaine Bartell and their families. Friend to many. He passed, surrounded by loved ones at his hospital bedside, on his 75th birthday. A generous man of service to many causes which interested him and of a positive spirit that affected many lives. He valiantly fought AML, first diagnosed on February 2, 2014, and came up just short of remission after multiple rounds of Chemo which would have qualified him for a promising but risky Stem Cell Transplant. The Chemo was approaching remission. But it also destroyed his Immune System and made him vulnerable to multiple infections that he succumbed to.

MARKMAN--Glenn. The Association for a Better New York mourns the loss of our good friend and member Glenn Markman. He was a quintessential New Yorker and his impact on our city was immeasurable. He will be dearly missed. Bill Rudin, Chairman Jen Hensley, Executive Director

LUXENBERG--Stanley. Beloved father of Daniel and Louis, died October 31, 2014, after battling cancer for six months. His wife, Sara Holiner, died seven years earlier. Stanley was a prominent business journalist for nearly forty years. A graduate of Swarthmore College and the Columbia Journalism School, he had a long career as an editor for magazines and newspapers and as a freelance business writer. He was the author of the book, "Roadside Empires," and contributed frequently to The New York Times, The Street.com and many magazines. He was an expert on mutual funds and investing and published a newsletter, the Critical Investor. The publications where he worked included: the New Leader, Businessweek, Forbes, Newsday, Medical Economics and Individual Investor, where he was executive editor. He wrote a landmark article on socially responsible investing for Harper's Magazine in 1982. He was one of the founders of the New York Media Alliance and the National Writers Union. He was an active member of Temple Rodeph Sholom and participated in its social justice efforts. He also studied at the Hebrew University in Jerusalem. Born in Indiana, PA, on April 5, 1951, he is survived by his parents, Irene and David Luxenberg, his sister Deborah and brother Larry and his partner Sue Mittenthal. Funeral services are 11:45am, Monday, November 3 at Riverside Memorial Chapel with burial immediately afterwards at New Mount Lebanon Cemetery, Iselin, NJ.

LOVE--Lisa. Lisa Love, died of cancer November 1, 2014 surrounded by family and friends. Born in Greenwich, CT January 17, 1959, she attended local schools including Greenwich Academy, Greenwich Country Day School, and graduated from Greenwich High School. She earned a BA in business from University of Vermont, and worked for Vanderbilt Chemical Company in Norwalk as an accountant. After a Masters degree from Pratt in NY, she became an interior designer, founding her own firm, Lisa Love Designs, recently, located in her store in Westport, Love and Company, where in addition to design services, she sold home d

KATZ--ELAINE Arnowich, 85 yrs young passed November 1. Predeceased by parents Joe & Eva Arnowich, beloved husband of 56 yrs Phil, brother Ira, cherished son, Steve. A loving mother to Ellyn & Jeff, Rob & Sherrill, Deborah & Mark. She relished being Nanny to Mat, Ben, Emma & Zoe. She adored sisters-in-law Sandra & Gladys & was Auntie Elaine to loving nieces/ nephews. She was a force of nature, living a full active life, always giving to others. She was much loved by many. She will be missed.

KAFFE-ROSENBERG-- Dr. Sara. A dedicated physician and woman of fierce intellect, sharp wit and endless devotion to her family. She passed away August 12 and is survived by her children, Yuval and Anat; her former husband, Dr. Vladimiro Rosenberg; her brother, Israel Kaffe; and her two grandchildren, Leo and Ella. Memorial service Sunday, November 9, 2014, 2pm at "The Riverside," 180 W. 76th St. Donations in her memory may be made to the Alzheimer's Association and to the Visiting Nurse Service of New York.
HYDOCK--Jerry died October 27, 2014. Jerry lived in Warren, NJ then Houston, TX. He is survived by his two sons Luke & Jordan Hydock and his three grandsons.

GOULD--Evelyn, 96, White Plains, New York on November 4, 2014. Beloved wife of the late Abbott Gould; Adored Mother of Arlene Gould (Bruce Simmons) and Kenneth J. Gould (Jane); Loving Grandmother of Elizabeth Gould and Caroline Gould Lewittes (William); Devoted Great Nanny of Isabel and Henry Lewittes. Services Thursday, November 6 at 10 a.m., Riverside Memorial Chapel, Mt. Vernon, NY. Burial Mt. Lebanon Cemetery, Glendale, NY.

FINE--Eli B.,of Delray Beach, Florida, formerly of Yonkers, NY, passed away on November 2, 2014. He was born in Yonkers, NY on November 13, 1920. Eli graduated from NYU with a Bachelor's degree and was a CPA. He was active for many years in Yonkers, Westchester and Palm Beach County in the business, civic, education and religious community. He is survived by his loving wife Roslyn Fine, adoring children Ellen, Fred, (spouse Sondra), grandson Liam Fine, stepchildren Ilene Merdinger (spouse Randy Scharringhausen), Steven Merdinger (Lauri Fliegel), and granddaughter Blake Merdinger. He was predeceased by his late wife Lila G. Fine, brother Herman Fine and sister Florence Friedman. Funeral service will be held at 11:00am, Wednesday, November 5, 2014 at Mount Hope Cemetery.

BUSSEL--Irving, died November 1, 2014. He was born on July 17, 1926 in Plainfield, NJ. His parents were the late Max and Sarah Bussel. Irving attended New York University and the New School of Social Research. He was a Research Editor for the Anti Defamation League in New York for over 40 years. He is survived by a brother, Eli Bussell of Edison, NJ, a sister, Roselyn Ramist of Stamford, CT, and nieces and nephews Lisa, Frank, Joanne, Lauren, and Jordan.

BENNETT--William Stephen, of Bronxville, New York died on October 29, 2014. His family and many close friends will miss him deeply. A service will be held on November 6 at 4pm at the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest in New York City. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Saltaire Volunteer Fire Co., Bay Shore, NY.

APPEL--Beatrice H.,of New York City, on November 1, 2014, in her 105th year. Daughter of Samuel L. and Eva Hoffman, she had been married to Alfred for 69 years. She was a graduate of Adelphi Academy, attended Adelphi College, and was a graduate of the American Academy of Dramatic Arts. For four years she was a volunteer guide at the United Nations in Lake Success, and spent twenty-four years as a docent at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, specializing in Egyptology, about which she was passionate. She also loved studying and teaching art history, and taught English to Russian emigres. She was an elegant, bright, and dynamic lady, who adored her family and is survived by her children, Prof. Nina S. Appel (late Alfred, Jr.), Betty and Paul Schaffer, and John S. Appel and Barbara Wolkowitz, her grandchildren Karen and Gene Oshman, Richard J. Appel, Dr. Mark A. Schaffer and David Goldman, and Catherine and Michael Rose, and her great-grandchildren Stephen and Katherine, Gabriel and Grace, and Andrew and Jenna. Also surviving is her devoted brother, Dr. Burton P. Hoffman, and his family. Services on Thursday, November 6, 2014, 10am, at Frank E. Campbell, 1076 Madison Ave. at 81st St.

SPITZER--Bernard. Columbia University Medical Center mourns the passing of our friend Bernard Spitzer, whose generosity and foresight were instrumental to our work understanding and treating Parkinson's disease. All of us at Columbia extend our condolences to his wife, Anne; children Emily, Daniel and Eliot; and the extended Spitzer family. Lee Goldman, M. D. Executive Vice President and Dean of the Faculties of Health Sciences and Medicine Columbia University 1/3

RASKE--Eleanore. Greater New York Hospital Association (GNYHA) mourns the passing of Eleanore Raske, 92, beloved mother of GNYHA President Kenneth E. Raske. Eleanore passed away peacefully at home in New Rochelle, NY, on November 1. The beloved wife of the deceased Edward J. Raske, Eleanore's long and rewarding life was marked by a deep devotion to her family. She is survived by her son Kenneth, daughter-in-law Janet, grandson Matthew and his wife Lisa, granddaughters Sarah and Elizabeth, and great-granddaughter Ava. A private funeral service will be held in Chicago on November 8. In lieu of flowers, the family requests that donations be made to the Calvary Fund, 1740 Eastchester Road, Bronx, NY 10461, or The Hebrew Home at Riverdale, c/o Development Office, 5901 Palisade Avenue, Riverdale, NY 10471. The entire GNYHA family extends its deepest condolences to the Raske family. Louis A. Shapiro Chairman, GNYHA Lee H. Perlman President, GNYHA Ventures 1/3

PEDOWITZ--Rose Diane (nee Winick) of Short Hills, NJ was born in New York City, November 10, 1916 and died of natural causes on November 3, 2014. Married June 7, 1941 to Paul Pedowitz, M.D., she is survived by her four children Walter, Arnold, Richard, and Robin (Kastrinsky) along with her seven grandchildren and seven great- grandchildren. She worked as a psychiatric social worker and was a psychoanalyst in private practice until 2009. She graduated with a BS from Brooklyn College and received an MSW from Adelphi University. She was a dedicated mother and loved her children and grandchildren dearly. 1

MEIROWITZ--Martin, age 85, on November 5, 2014. Beloved and devoted husband of Harriett for 52 years. Loving father of Suzanne Nederlander, Clifford, Spencer and Lewis and father-in-law of Robert Nederlander, Alexandra, Lauren and Natalie. Devoted and cherished grandfather of Richard, William, Ava, Jacob, Jordan, Justin, Isabel, Lucas, Deborah, Harry and Dylan. Forever in our hearts. Services today, 11:30am at "The Riverside," 76th Street and Amsterdam Avenue. 1/3

MARKMAN--Glenn. The Edith and Carl Marks Jewish Community House of Bensonhurst mourns the loss of our dear friend, supporter, alumnus and distinguished board member Glenn Markman. BEERMAN--Toby, peacefully passed away November 4, 2014. Survived by her beloved husband of 69 years Justice Leon A. Beerman, adoring sons Barry and Alen and daughter-in-law Sue, loving grandchildren Hal and wife Audrey, Audra and husband Michael, the lights of her life great-grandchildren, Benji, Brianna and Ari. Toby was much loved by many and will be sorely missed. Funeral Thursday, November 6, 2014 at 12:45pm, Sinai Chapels, 162- 05 Horace Harding Expwy, Fresh Meadows. 1/3

BALLEN--Suzanne Janice (daughter of Arthur and Hannah Kalfus) May 31, 1925 -November 2, 2014. Born and raised in the Bronx, lived in Old Westbury, NY and Caesarea, Israel. Most recently of Key Biscayne, FL. Dearly beloved wife of Peter H. Ballen, MD. Mother of Stephen Z. (Kathleen) and Ann Elizabeth (Juan P. Aguilar). Adored grandmother of Liza, Jonathan (Katie), Cissy, and Rebecca. Twinkling blue eyes, heart full of love, elegant in posture and manner. Her children rise and celebrate her, and her husband praises her: Many daughters have attained valor, but you have surpassed them all. Contributions appreciated. Greater Miami Jewish Federation www.gmjf.org or Bet Shira www.betshira.org. 1

MARKMAN--Glenn. The Rudin family and the employees of Rudin Management Company mourn the passing of Glenn Markman, a treasured colleague and friend. He was a valued leader and advisor who gained recognition in his real estate career by advocating for both his beloved Brooklyn and New York City. We will deeply miss Glenn's integrity, humility, spirit, and friendship, and send condolences to Jan, Clio, Edie Ray and his entire family. Jack Rudin, Chairman Bill Rudin, CEO and Co-Vice Chairman Eric Rudin, President and Co-Vice Chairman

MARKMAN--Glenn. The Board of Managers of the Leighton House is deeply saddened by the passing of Glenn Markman, a former board member. Glenn was our long time neighbor and friend, and will be missed by all who knew him. On behalf of the residents and staff, we offer our deepest condolences to his wife Jan, son Clio and daughter Edie. The Board of Managers

MARKMAN--Glenn David August 12, 1962 November 4, 2014. Glenn Markman, whose passion, creativity and entrepreneurial spirit transformed his home borough of Brooklyn, lost a courageous battle with cancer at age 52. Glenn spent 28 years in commercial real estate, most recently as Vice Chairman of Cushman & Wakefield. As successful as Glenn was at business, he was even prouder of his accomplishments in philanthropy and civic endeavors. He put his leadership skills to work as a David Rockefeller Fellow, towards the Downtown Brooklyn Partnership, the Trevor Day School, and this past June, as an award recipient for the Brooklyn Hospital Foundation. The Brooklyn Nets honored Glenn on Monday night, for his love of the game and his many contributions to the Barclays Center. Glenn got Brooklyn before Brooklyn was cool. He is beloved by his family and his many friends. Glenn is survived by his wife of 21 years, Jan Testori-Markman, their son Clio and daughter Edie; parents Marty and Karen Markman; his brother Greg and family. The funeral service is planned for this morning at 11 a.m., at the Museum of Jewish Heritage, 36 Battery Place, NY, NY. If you wish to honor Glenns memory, contributions can be made to the New York Community Trust-Glenn Markman Memorial Fund, 909 Third Avenue, 22nd floor, NY NY, 10022.

LIFSHITZ--Sylvia. Beloved wife of Isaac, mother of Allon and Michelle, mother-in-law of Estela, grandmother of Nicolas and friend to many, many others. She passed away peacefully on November 4th, surrounded by her family, after a year-long battle with cancer. All who knew her loved her. She served residents of Manhattan's Upper East Side with care and loving humor as a neighborhood pharmacist for over 35 years. We miss her already and will think of her all our remaining days. Funeral services will be held at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, 630 Amsterdam Avenue, on November 6 at 1:30 pm.
HYDOCK--Jerry died October 27, 2014. Jerry lived in Warren, NJ then Houston, TX. He is survived by his two sons Luke & Jordan Hydock and his three grandsons.

BENNETT--William Stephen, of Bronxville, New York died on October 29, 2014. His family and many close friends will miss him deeply. A service will be held on November 6 at 4pm at the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest in New York City. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Saltaire Volunteer Fire Co., Bay Shore, NY.
